measured_by: Mean approval rating of 20 specific conspiracy theories questionnaire
justification: “The tendency to endorse conspiracy theories, defined as conspiracy belief (CB), was measured using the classical approach of asking participants to rate several specific conspiracy theories regarding their respective approval… The mean approval rate of said theories is then interpreted as a measure for the superordinate general CB.”

measured_by: Need for Cognition scale (subscale of the Rational-Experiential Inventory)
justification: “Analytic and intuitive reasoning was measured with the German version of the Rational-Experiental Inventory… The Need for Cognition scale consists of 14 items measuring the preference for an analytical thinking style.”

measured_by: Faith in Intuition scale (subscale of the Rational-Experiential Inventory)
justification: “Analytic and intuitive reasoning was measured with the German version of the Rational-Experiental Inventory… The Faith in Intuition scale consists of 15 items measuring the preference for an intuitive thinking style.”

measured_by: Fish task (modified beads task) with draws-to-decision metric
justification: “The JTC-bias was measured with a modified version of the traditional beads task. The fish task uses a more easily understandable scenario… A decision after one or two fish is considered as a JTC-bias, while the number of draws to decision (DTD) is recorded.”
